H0.text: To dissipate the heat of the hot water flowing through the pipe, the small flat plates called fins are used in a baseboard forced hot water system.

H1.text: The fins in a baseboard forced hot water system are intended to prevent the baseboard from coming into contact with hot surfaces.

H2.text: To replace the heated air leaving the system with cold air is the purpose of the small, flat plates called fins in a baseboard forced hot water system that carries hot water through a pipe.

H3.text: In a baseboard forced hotâ€‘water system, where hot water flows through a pipe that passes through many small, flat plates called fins, the purpose of these fins is to prevent dust and other particles from entering the baseboard.

A4.text: Fins dramatically increase the surface area with which heat can be exchanged, which improves the efficiency of conducting heat to a fluid with very low thermal conductivity, such as air.

A5.text: The fins are typically made from aluminium or copper since they must conduct heat from the tube along the length of the fins, which are usually very thin.
